Concretely , we useΨB˜B = idV and ΞC˜C = idW, i.e., the identity mappings
that map vectors onto themselves, but with respect to a different basis.
Deﬁnition 2.21 (Equivalence). Two matricesA, ˜A∈Rm×n are equivalentequivalent
if there exist regular matrices S ∈ Rn×n and T ∈ Rm×m, such that
˜A= T−1AS.
Deﬁnition 2.22 (Similarity). Two matrices A, ˜A ∈Rn×n are similar ifsimilar
there exists a regular matrix S∈Rn×n with ˜A= S−1AS
